title: AB 1175
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. Section 9873 of the Business and Professions Code outlines the fees for registration of electronic repair industry service dealers and appliance repair industry service dealers. The initial registration fee is set at $205 for each place of business in the state. Service contractors have an initial registration fee of $95 per place of business. The initial registration fee for a person who is both an electronic repair industry service dealer and an appliance repair industry service dealer is $405 per place of business in the state. For service contractors who are either electronic repair industry service dealers or appliance repair industry service dealers, the fee is $300 per place of business. The registration fee for a person engaged in both electronic and appliance repair industries is $500 per place of business in the state. If a service dealer or contractor operates without a physical location in the state but conducts business in electronic or appliance repair, they must pay the registration fee as if they had a place of business in the state. The annual registration renewal fee for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers is $205 per place of business if renewed before expiration. For service contractors, the fee is $95 per place of business. Dealers engaging in both industries pay up to $400 per place of business in the state. The annual renewal fee for service dealers in the electronic and appliance repair industry is up to $400 per place of business in the state. Service contractors pay up to $475 per place of business. The annual renewal fee for service dealers in the electronic and appliance repair industry is not more than $475 per place of business in the state. Service contractors without a physical location in the state pay the same fee as if they had a place of business in the state. The delinquency fee is 50 percent of the renewal fee for a license, effective until January 1, 2019, unless extended by a later statute. The director cannot increase any fee in this section before January 1, 2017. Section 9873 of the Business and Professions Code is being amended. Section 9873 of the Business and Professions Code is amended to set fees for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers. The initial registration fee is $205 for each place of business, or $405 for those engaging in both services. The annual registration renewal fee for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers is $205 per place of business, or $400 for those engaging in both services. A delinquency fee of 50% of the renewal fee applies. This section becomes effective on January 1, 2019. The delinquency fee is 50% of the renewal fee for a license, effective January 1, 2019. The fee for issuance and renewal of licenses under this chapter is set by the chief, with a maximum and minimum amount specified for different types of licenses. The fees for different types of licenses under this chapter have a maximum and minimum amount specified. Importer’s license: $940 maximum, $120 minimum. Furniture and bedding manufacturer’s license: $940 maximum, $120 minimum. Wholesale furniture and bedding dealer’s license: $675 maximum, $120 minimum. Supply dealer’s license: $675 maximum, $120 minimum. Custom upholsterer’s license: $450 maximum, $80 minimum. Sanitizer’s license: $450 maximum, $80 minimum. Retail furniture and bedding dealer’s license: $300 maximum, $40 minimum. Retail furniture dealer’s license: $150 maximum, $20 minimum. Retail bedding dealer’s license: $150 maximum, $20 minimum. Individuals making pillows, quilts, quilted pads, or comforters in their own homes are exempt from fee requirements but must comply with all other provisions of the chapter. Retailers selling "used" and "antique" furniture are exempt from fee requirements and other provisions of the chapter. Those selling upholstered furniture and bedding, as well as fitness and exercise furniture, must comply with fee requirements. A person licensed as an upholstered furniture or bedding manufacturer does not need to pay an additional fee for a sanitizer's license.
